ACCELEROMETER.doc: Acceleration item for a dataset with gravitational constant g as unit.

subKeys.doc: Acceleration x axis with gravitational constant g as unit.
Acceleration y axis with gravitational constant g as unit.
Acceleration z axis with gravitational constant g as unit.

BATTERY.doc: Battery level in percentage as unit.

BLOOD_VOLUME_PULSE.doc: Blood volumne pulse from photoplethysmograph expressed in light absorption (nW).

ELECTRODERMAL_ACTIVITY.doc: Electrodermal activity in microsiemens (µS) as unit.

HEART_RATE.doc: Heart Rate resulting from data aggregation. It is computed as (60 / ibi)

THERMOMETER.doc: Temperature value expressed in Celsius (°C) scale

AVERAGE.doc: The sum of a list of numbers divided by the number of numbers in the list.

COUNT.doc: The number of occurances within a set of data.

MAXIMUM.doc: The most extreme value in set.

MEDIAN.doc: The median is the value separating the higher half of a set of values from the lower half.

MINIMUM.doc: The least or the smallest value in a set.

SUM.doc: The result of the addition of a sequence of numbers.

INTERQUARTILE_RANGE.doc: A measure of statistical dispersion, being equal to the difference between 75th and 25th percentiles, or between upper and lower quartiles.

LOWER_QUARTILE.doc: A point at the 1st quartile or 25th percentile in a ranked set of data values.

UPPER_QUARTILE.doc: A point at the 3rd quartile or 75th percentile in a ranked set of data values.

QUARTILES.doc: The quartiles of a ranked set of data values are the three points that divide the data set into four equal groups.

unit.doc: All possible units requested data is returned as.

BEATS_PER_MIN.doc: Number of events (heart beats) per minute.

G.doc: The g-force (with g from gravitational) is a measurement of the type of acceleration that causes a perception of weight

C.doc: Celsius, also known as centigrade, is a metric scale and unit of measurement for temperature.

timeInterval.doc: Available time intervals in which requested data is returned.
